intro: Clidemia sericea, commonly known as silverleaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Clidemia sericea is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a potential invasive species in certain regions.
